intro: Pentzia athanasioides, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
